name: Desert Gardens Hotel, Ayers Rock Resort

reviews.text: We spent one night here in mid Oct 2007 and found the hotel to be more than adequate. Although the room wasn't ready when we first arrived (3pm), which was a bit of a pain, when we did get in later in the evening, it turned out to be a lovely room. Extremely spacious and comfortable with 2 double beds and adequate storage for suitcases etc. Nice warm, earthy coloured decor. The bathroom was also beautiful and massive with nice cream-coloured tiles and a proper walk-in shower (not in bath as is often the case).
reviews.title: Good 4* option

reviews.text: As already stated, the hotel is not a high rise, but rather, ground-floor bungalows spread out in a campus-like setting. We ate the breakfast at the restaurant there (from memory it cost around A$ 29 per person) and it was very nice. We didn't eat at the hotel for dinner...but elsewhere in the resort are various other restaurants and we chose the Gecko's Café at the main resort centre. It's one of the cheaper options but has very good food in a pleasant setting.
reviews.title: Your only option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were ok, but not overly helpful...and the 10am check-out was a bit rich, considering we only got into our room quite late the night before. I know quite a few guests were caught out by this early check-out time.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Impressed

reviews.text: If you want to see the rock, I would suggest doing the Uluru Express tour (which someone on the TA forum recommended to me)...we did the sunset tour and found it to be a good option for those not wanting to exert themselves too much!
reviews.title: Overall a good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the resort shuttle to all the hotels in the resort and think the Desert Gardens was probably the best option for people wanting a comfortable stay (the Sails in the Desert was also nice, but obviously more expensive). I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Terrible- but you must see Uluru

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in July 2007 with a Globus tour group.
reviews.title: Desert Gardens Hotel at Uluru-Kata Tjuta National Park

likes.disliked: — ants and spiders in my room, and it was extremely overpriced

reviews.text: There are several blocks of buildings all with outside entrances and corridors.
reviews.title: Desert Gardens Hotel Ayers Rock

likes.disliked: — ants and spiders in my room, and it was extremely overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we were given looked ok at first, but upon inspection we realized there were some problems. There was a huge spider's web hanging in the corner over the bed. There were also ants crawling all over the floor and walls. Then we noticed how there was a large gap on the side and at the bottom of the door where all sorts of things could crawl in. The front desk told us that the block of rooms that our tour group was given had not been used in over a month, which led to the ants and spiders. They also told us that they had had bug problems in that particular room before also.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk was able to get us another room in another block of buildings. The new room looked exactly the same minus the bugs.
reviews.title: Glorified Motel -- Monopoly in Play here. Beware!

likes.disliked: — Zero Value, lack of room-making, feels like a motel

reviews.text: There was a small pool area in the middle of the hotel buildings.
reviews.title: Reasonable but could be better with a little thought.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Desert Gardens hotel for 1 night on our honeymoon tour. We heard not to expect too much as it is in the middle of nowhere, but we were suitable impressed. The staff we very helpful and we got an upgrade on our room.
reviews.title: We loved it!

reviews.text: The trips we had booked - sunset and sunrise tours, left on time and the guides were very knowledgeble about the Aboriginals and the land around.
reviews.title: A reasonable base in the middle of nowhere!

likes.liked: — Convenience for travelling to Uluru/Kata Tjuta
likes.disliked: — A bit basic and the Flies!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a supermarket on site that we bought food to have in the morning as we were up at 5am and none of the restaurants are open then.
reviews.title: Its all about Uluru.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner at the Outback Pioneer Lodge where you buy your meat and cook it on the BBQ, there is also unlimited salad cart and jacket
reviews.title: Adequate , average. Nothing special
As good as any
reviews.text: potatoes that you help yourself to. We had a great time! There is a small suttle bus that goes round evey hotel and you can get off and on where you like. Its about 15 mins to go round all the hotels.
The facility itself is well laid out and all that you expect with a four star hotel. Now the problems, of which a lot of it boils down to being understaffed.
reviews.title: clean room but service needs some work

likes.disliked: — service needs to be number one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Beware of wakeup calls for the sunrise tour. Ours came at 9 pm that evening and then 4 am the morning following the tour and we weren't the only ones. Lucky I woke up at 4:25 am and had everything ready or I would have missed an experience of a lifetime.
reviews.title: Good accommodation

likes.disliked: — Nothing in regard to the accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Don't eat at the restaurant at the Desert Gardens if you expect timely service. It took almost 2 hours to get our meal and this was only after I asked if they had to kill the cow first. Also make sure you have your hostess explain the menu and pricing, because most people we spoke with had the same problems we had when it came to the bill..Save yourself from the surprise. By the way, the food was excellent.
reviews.title: An all round average experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3.Overall, the facility is severely understaffed and is understandable as it is in the middle of nowhere. The staff do the best they can, but I am sure the resort could do better if they had more staff.( ie.) Five busloads arrived at the same time and the hotel only had 2 staff for checkin and 1 busboy to handle all the storage of luggage as the rooms were not ready at 1 pm in the afternoon. Even I would have thought to pull my hair out. if I had been this staff.
reviews.title: Huge Tourist Trap

likes.disliked: — the shower flooding the bathroom with each use

reviews.title: -+Make Uluru a day trip. avoid the Hotels
reviews.text: Stayed at Desert Gardens for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. I would normally check the reviews on TripAdvisor before booking but didn't with this one, which was just as well as I think I would have been put off Desert Gardens by some of the previous comments!

aka: Desert Gardens Hotel, Ayers Rock Hotel Yulara
description: Voyages Desert Gardens Hotel is a superior hotel at Voyages Ayers Rock Resort. Magnificent ghost gums and flowering native shrubs are the setting for this hotel. Voyages Desert Gardens Hotel is centrally located to all resort and touring facilities and offers a range of accommodation, from shaded poolside rooms to deluxe rooms overlooking the desert.You can relax in the comfort of your own private balcony or courtyard, or unwind in the hotel's pool, sipping cocktails from the Bunya bar. It's only a short stroll to the Resort's numerous lookouts, where you can view what is arguably Australia's best sunset, with the spectacular play of colours across the face of Uluru and the surrounding desert. Once the sun has set, dine at Arnguli Grill and savour an a la carte flame grilled menu.
